HTC Wildfire S Which carrier are you using? Vodafone What language is your device set to? English (UK) Which version of Android are you using? entry.title: Excessive battery drain using widget on ICS
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run a leaked version of ICS with Sense What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? While I realise it is unfair to expect you to support leaked versions of Google Os's, I wanted to report this to highlight a future possible issue when officially Release, when using this widget on ICS my battery drains from full charge to 0 in under 6 hours. Now removed the widget and today over 13 hours and still 65% left. This was on a clean install. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Free Which device are you using? HTC Sensation Which carrier are you using? Vodafone UK What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? ICS leak with Sense Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here:
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Disable Lock screen does no longer work
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Pressing the button Disable Lock Screen, and the button changes to Reenable Lock Screen - however the screen is always locked whenever I switch on the phone. 2. Same thing when charging the phone, the screen is always locked when switched on. 3. This used to work - all the necessary options under in the menu have been set. What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? The screen is alway locked when the phone is switched on What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Battery Indicator Pro version 5.1.1 Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy S2 (GT-I9100) Which carrier are you using? TDC MOBIL (23801) What language is your device set to? Danish Which version of Android are you using? ver 2.3.5 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here: --

entry.title: Icon jumps position
entry.content:
I have 3 icons in the top left: battery-indicator, juice-defender and 3g watchdog.
When battery-indicator is running then the position of battery-indicator icon shifts amongst the other icons about every 30 seconds. I'd expect it to stay in the same place. When the battery-indicator icon is disabled the other icons remain in the same place.
This is very distracting when reading a book.
I'm using the free branch, version 4.1.1 Im using a samsung galaxy s2 Carrier is Telecom XT (New Zealand) Language is English Android Version 2.3.3 AutoKiller memory is installed.

entry.title: Extreme Percentage jump on Samsung Galaxy S2
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Restarting the phone 2. Charging the phone 3. [Add or remove numbers as necessary] What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? Today I was using my phone, showing 57% battery left, than my friend told me on the phone sorry I cannot hear you, so I restarted it. Came back 29% battery available after the restart. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy S2 - I9100XXLPR Which carrier are you using? O2 carrier in UK What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? Android version 4.0.3 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? Yes, but it's not allowed to kill Battery Indicator Pro Please provide any additional information here: Once happened when I was charging my phone the Battery Indicator Pro showed 97% charge, when the original battery checker told me it's 100% full. Couple of times happened after restarting the phone the battery level extremely dropped down after restart. I didn't bothered to report it down, because I'm not sure this is a phone failure or software failure. Phone was once sent away for repair, because the network connection wasn't available to the carrier. These days I'm having similar issues with it, and I requested Samsung to respond to my issues.
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Causing "Android OS" to use considerably more battery
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Noticed android OS was using more battery than my screen. 2.Factory reset. 3. Installed all suspect apps 1 at a time 2h between watching for Android OS to spike. 4. After having this app installed for 2h noticed Android OS had passed all but WiFi and screen. 5. Charged to 100% to reset usage. 2h after unplugging Android OS was the #1 battery user. 6. Uninstalled and repeated step 5, Screen was #1, Android OS was #6. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? FREE Which device are you using? Droid RAZR Which carrier are you using? Verizon What language is your device set to? English (US) Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.6 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here:
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: app preventing native gmail preview in Jellybean notification pull down
entry.content:
The app in the pull down notification bar for jellybean prevents gmail preview. (Native feature) 1.install battery indicator 2.get gmail, notice notification bar doesn't preview message 3.uninstall batter indicator and notice the gmail preview works properly
Either make the battery indicator notification pull down optional or fix what is preventing gmail preview.
Pro, 6.0.1
Galaxy Nexus, Jellybean 4.1.1, Verizon
English, US
Jellybean 4.1.1
No task killer
Email me at nickaggie@gmail if you need more details or want me to test a dev version. This is the 5th android device I've used your program on and this is my first ever issue.
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Random behavior of Disable Lock Screen
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Disable lock screen from BIP GUI or select Auto-disable option (both ways trigger the same behavior) 2. Turn off the screen 3. Turn on the screen What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? I expect Lock screen never to appear after step 1. In reality, in step 3 sometimes I see Home screen, sometimes I see Lock screen! If the screen was not locked in step 3, then starting any app with its GUI (email, BIP) suddenly triggers Lock screen What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro 6.0.1 Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy S2 Epic 4G Touch Which carrier are you using? Sprint What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? Freshly updated from GB to ICS 4.0.4 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No task killers. I only monitor processes using System Panel 1.1.1 Please provide any additional information here: My lock screen is a "pattern" kind, but I also checked slide and PIN kinds and the result is the same.
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Disable lock-screen not working properly
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Activate "disable lock screen" 2. Launch BIP from notification bar (the screen locks itself) What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? The screen should stay unlocked. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? PRO 6.0.2 Which device are you using? Sony Ericsson Xperia Neo V Which carrier are you using? Proximus (Belgium) What language is your device set to? French Which version of Android are you using? 4.0.4 Do you have a "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here: If BIP is launched from applications menu, the screen stays unlocked but if BIP is launched from notification bar, the screen is locked. We have to disable and re-enable "disable lock screen".

entry.title: indicator doesnt update batterylevel after updating androide from 2.3.3 to 2.3.5
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. I used batteryindicator free for 1 year on my Huawei U8510 with android 2.3.3, it always worked fine 2. recently I updatet android to version 2.3.5 and had to reinstall all my apps including batteryindicator(free), I dont use any taskkillerapp 3. the phone is rooted to allow to use VPNC with my Fritzbox 4. also when VPNC is not active batteryindicator often stops to update the procentage evenso the battery is drainde and the official android indicater shows a lower level. Batteryindicator percentage is immidiately updated when I open the app. What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? precentage should update but often doesnt, all with screen unlocked most of the time. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? free Which device are you using? Huawei U8510 Which carrier are you using? Vodafone Germany (reseller 1&1) What language is your device set to? German Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.5 (before with 2.3.3 the problem was not there) Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? no taskkiller only an SMS-interceptor(my calculator), a virusscanner (virusfighter), facebookapp,Chat multiclient (Nimbuzz), Mailclient (maildroid), VPN-widget (VPNC), Filemanager (totalcomander with plugins for FTP, WLAN and WEBDAV), AVM-Fritzphoneapp Please provide any additional information here: rooted to use VPNC
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect
